noun.description: A device or implement, especially one held in the hand, used to carry out a particular function.
A distinct design in the tooling of a book.

verb.description: Impress a design on (leather, especially a leather book cover)
examples: volumes bound in green leather and tooled in gold

verb.description: Equip or be equipped with tools for industrial production.
examples: the factory must be tooled to produce the models
they were tooling up for production

verb.description: Drive or ride in a casual or leisurely manner.
examples: tooling around town in a pink Rolls-Royce

origin: Old English t≈çl, from a Germanic base meaning prepare; compare with taw. The verb dates from the early 19th century.
